title: Senior Software Engineer (Node.js)
description:
We love Recruiting, and building amazing Recruiting Software.

JOIN is a brand new Recruiting platform to save time and money.

We are working at a fervent pace to truly change hiring and recruiting. Our vision is to match exciting companies with the best candidates, in the most efficient way possible. Unifying applicant tracking system (ATS), Multiposting and Performance Recruiting, we are striving to bring digital recruitment to a new level.

This position is available both to remote team members (must be in a timezone ±3 hours from Berlin) and to those interested in working from our office in the heart of Berlin.

OUR DEVELOPMENT VALUES

We are passionate about technology, and about quality. We use only modern technologies: TypeScript, Node.js, gcloud, Kubernetes, Docker, gRPC, Postgres, Redis, AWS, AWS Lambda, Micro-services. We believe in automation. We automate anything and everything that can improve our productivity and focus. We work in a CI/CD pipeline. We are not “just” coders — we are always thinking about our product and how to improve the experience of our Clients. We value transparency, close collaboration, and a certain amount of chaos in our work because it makes us faster and more creative.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

Participate in architectural decision-making. Build scalable backend systems for our applications, with the opportunity to work on other parts of the stack as well. Conduct peer code reviews. Right from the start, you will be expected to suggest and implement your own ideas and projects.

YOU WILL BE A GREAT FIT FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU

Enjoy helping those around to you grow and be successful as developers. Can be autonomous and self-driven. Get inspired on a daily basis, think of new ideas, and like to share them with others. Love to experiment and to use data to drive decision making. Can communicate and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver compelling products and services. Have the ability to take on complex problems, learn quickly, and persist towards a good solution.

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

5+ years of development experience Strong development experience in Node.js A strong technical background, with experience using modern web technologies Experience with TDD and continuous integration processes (CI/CD) Experience with relational and non-relational (e.g., PostgreSQL, Redis etc.) data stores Experience writing and utilizing RESTful API services Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes Experience with gcloud or AWS would be a plus

WHAT WE OFFER

Working with a committed, successful and international team. A friendly and vibrant working culture of people who are keen to help each other. The opportunity to contribute to an amazing product and help take it to the international level. Working independently and gaining a lot of insight into the field of web software (SaaS) development. A salary adequate to your experiences and skills. Room to grow within the company. A “forgiveness, not permission” attitude.

Interested?

If you would like to be part of our success story, please submit your application and be sure to include a cover letter stating your earliest starting date and salary expectations, and whether you are interested in working remotely or from our Berlin office.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Engineering Manager (f/m/d) Technology Company seeks Leader
description:
Hi,

we are Lothar, Tammo, Jan, Magnus and Oliver from the tech department. Together with our cross-functional teams we are responsible for creating the software solutions that our product team envisions and which our customers love. We are currently looking for a tech lead that will lead and grow our engineering teams in Berlin.

FIRST A QUICK LOOK AT US

Daimler AG and BMW Group are bundling their mobility services in the areas of Carsharing, Ride- Hailing, Parking, Charging and Multimodal Platforms, and create a new global player comprising of five joint ventures. moovel Group is joining forces with ReachNow - and becomes REACH NOW

Our vision is a planet without traffic jams. Our mission is to transform cities by providing the most convenient and sustainable mobility solutions. We create outstanding products with technical excellence, an agile mindset, an open feedback and failure culture and fun at work. moovel (REACH NOW) is part of two global corporations, but at the heart of it we still are a start- up. We act as a partner for cities, transport networks and mobility service providers with the goal of making cities smarter and creating an operating system for urban mobility that provides access to appropriate mobility options in urban areas and paves the way for the future with autonomous vehicles. Currently, 300 employees work in small creative teams in Germany and the US at four locations - Hamburg, Berlin, Stuttgart and Portland.

SOME OF THE THINGS YOU WILL DO

  • Give guidance to the engineers in our Berlin squads in developing a modern, cloud based mobility platform
  • Grow our tech-organization in Berlin and foster an agile engineering culture
  • Engage and challenge our engineers with servant leadership and your ability to give purpose
  • Balance guidance and freedom and coach engineers
  • Represent our culture and product at events / or meetups together with engineers

ABOUT YOU

  • At moovel we work in cross-functional and agile engineering teams and you are experienced with a work environment like that plus you have long-term experience (5+ years) in building, growing and sustaining teams
  • Technical excellence is something you are striving for
  • You have a solid background in backend-focused development with technologies such as microservices, cloud-based infrastructure, API-driven development
  • It is helpful to be familiar with our Technology Stack (Node.js, JVM, AWS), most importantly, however, you should bring seniority in engineering, so our teams can trust in your ability to help them in their decision making process
  • You are passionate about moovel’s mission and want to create products that our customers love
  • You use the art of leadership to motivate and inspire your team in order to ensure the delivery of moovel’s mission
  • We live an open feedback culture so you need to be experienced with giving honest feedback in order to guide our moovelanos and foster their personal development
  • You are well connected and established a certain footprint within the technology space, which helps you to stay on top of the latest developments and attract talents to the company. Active participation in conferences, organisation of meetups or blogging activity would be helpful
  • Must be a caring human being

BENEFITS

  • Choose your own hardware
  • Working with newest technologies & microservices
  • Company pension plan
  • Free breakfast, good coffee & fresh fruits
  • Monthly mobility budget
  • Be part of an interdisciplinary team of experts
  • Working on products with a high impact on society
  • International teams
  • Child care allowance
  • Flexible working hours

In summary, we are looking for an experienced leader with a strong technical background for our Berlin location, that helps people grow and contributes to making our organization better. If this posting catches you and you are more than ready for this challenge, we definitely want to meet you.

Being a part of the exciting journey that lies ahead of us will be very rewarding. So just send us your application by clicking on application form.

Lothar, Jan, Tammo, Magnus and Oliver

Click here for the application form

If you have any questions or are in need for further information feel free to contact Janosch Fingerhut +49 30 549073811

title: Data Analyste IT Recherche SPHN
description:
Résumé du poste:

La Direction des système d'information du CHUV recherche un-e Data analyste IT Recherche, pour un CDI lié à un fonds, ceci afin de renforcer son équipe Data Science & Recherche.

Contexte:

Le Centre hospitalier universitaire vaudois (CHUV) est l'un des 5 hôpitaux universitaires suisses. Grâce à sa collaboration avec la Faculté de biologie et médecine de l'Université de Lausanne et l'EPFL, le CHUV joue un rôle de pointe dans les domaines des soins médicaux, de la recherche médicale et de la formation.

L’équipe Data Science & Recherche, rattachée à la Direction des systèmes d’information, met à disposition des investigateurs des données cliniques dépersonnalisées et codées afin qu’ils puissent mener leurs projets de recherche en respectant le cadre légal et éthique en vigueur.

Le CHUV et l’équipe Data Science & Recherche participent à l’initiative nationale SPHN (Swiss Personalized Health Network) pour promouvoir le développement de la médecine personnalisée et de la santé personnalisée en Suisse.

Missions:

  • Dans le domaine de la recherche clinique, vous collectez les données du Datawarehouse de recherche clinique du CHUV afin de les rendre interopérables avec les autres hôpitaux universitaires selon les besoins des projets SPHN
  • Vous effectuez les extractions et l'intégration de données, transcodage, encodage, livraison des données finales
  • Vous mettez en œuvre les techniques de data quality management appropriées et documentez les méta-données associées.

Profil:

  • Vous êtes informaticien-ne de formation et bénéficiez d’une expérience confirmée dans la gestion de données médicales ou dans le contexte de la recherche médicale
  • Vous êtes un expert dans la manipulation des données et vous avez une expérience confirmée avec SQL
  • Vous disposez de connaissances avec R et/ou Python, un plus
  • Vous êtes motivé-e par les technologies innovantes liées au big data De nature collaborative, vous avez plaisir à développer des relations avec les chercheurs, m médecins et experts informaticiens nécessaires pour trouver les solutions dans un contexte en pleine mutation
  • Orienté-e solutions, vous aimez participer à des projets et collaborez avec les métiers.

Nous offrons:

Devenir une collaboratrice ou un collaborateur du Centre hospitalier universitaire vaudois, c'est l'assurance de bénéficier :

  • De prestations sociales de premier ordre
  • D'un droit à trois jours de formation minimum par année
  • De 25 jours de vacances par année
  • De restaurants d'entreprise de qualité hôtelière, dans chacun des bâtiments de l'institution.

Contact et envoi de candidature:

Contact pour informations sur la fonction : Mme Nathalie Jacquemont, au 079 556 63 73.

Dans la mesure où toutes nos candidatures sont traitées de manière électronique, nous vous remercions de postuler exclusivement par internet, en cliquant sur le bouton POSTULER en bas de l’annonce. Si pour des raisons techniques, vous ne pouvez pas postuler en ligne, nous vous invitons à vous rendre physiquement auprès de notre équipe e-recrutement, qui vous accompagnera dans votre démarche (contact : 021.314.85.70). Nous vous répondons du lundi au vendredi de 8h00 à 11h30 et de 13h30 à 16h30.

Le CHUV applique les exigences de qualité les plus élevées dans le cadre de ses processus de recrutement. En outre, soucieux de promouvoir la diversité de nos collaboratrices et collaborateurs, nous sommes attentifs aux différents parcours de vie et mettons tout en œuvre pour garantir l’égalité de traitement et éviter toute discrimination. Nous nous réjouissons de recevoir votre candidature.

Nous remercions par avance les agences de placement de prendre bonne note que les candidatures insérées par leurs soins directement sur notre plateforme de recrutement ne sont pas acceptées et ne peuvent donner lieu à une facturation. Merci de votre compréhension.
how_to_apply: Nous vous remercions de postuler exclusivement par internet, en cliquant sur le bouton POSTULER en bas de l’annonce: https://recrutement.chuv.ch/vacancy/data-analyste-it-recherche-sphn-237448.html

title: Engineering Team Leads
description:
CircleCI is looking for Engineering Team Leads to support our engineering teams in continuously delivering user value. If you bring an engineering background and are excited about helping engineers deliver user value every day, and want to grow further towards engineering management, this role could be for you.

The Team Lead role is an essential part of our distributed engineering organization, and Team Leads play a key role in helping teams be healthy and understand and shape their daily work on delivering value to our users. As a Team Lead at CircleCI, you’ll become part of one of our engineering teams. You’ll spend around 80% of your time supporting your team, and around 20% of your time on hands-on technical work. The Team Lead role is the first step on CircleCI's engineering management career track.

Who you'll work with:

You'll join a distributed, cross-functional team of 6-8 people that includes both product and site reliability engineers. You'll collaborate with other Team Leads and work closely with:

Tech Leads: senior engineers responsible for driving technical decisions within their own teams and across the engineering organization.

Product Managers: collaborate with Product and your engineer teammates to solve our customers’ biggest challenges, jointly define milestones, and guide the team's weekly planning.

Engineering Managers: you'll report directly to an engineering manager who supports 1-2 teams on a more strategic level, coordinates staffing, and supports career development of you and your teammates.

As a Team Lead at CircleCI, you’ll have impact in the following areas:

User value delivery: Ensure incremental value delivery and high-quality standards for your team.

Partner with product managers to plan your team's strategic work.

Facilitation: Guide your team’s agile ceremonies on an ongoing basis. Plan and prepare those together with the Product Manager and Tech Lead for your team.

Planning: Collaborate with the engineering and product leadership teams on longer-term, strategic planning. Develop measurable OKRs and ensure the team utilises them to guide their work.

Knowledge sharing: Ensure that your teammates continue to learn and grow together as a team.

Process and Product: Maintain high levels of transparency, efficiency, and collaboration in your team, as well as with your peers and your team’s Product Manager.

Supporting growth of your team and your teammates: Work with your teammates and engineering leadership to make use of opportunities to grow.

Feedback & communication: Provide feedback to your teammates, as well as engineering leadership, on a regular basis. Communicate you team's progress towards its goals.

Technical work: In this role, you’ll spend 10-20% of your time coding, with frequent pair programming About you:

This role is most suited for folks with an engineering background who have started doing project and process management work already.—Do you love collaboration and teamwork? Are you eager to learn new things and help others learn, too? Are you a strong communicator in both synchronous and asynchronous mediums? If so, here’s the additional experience we’re looking for:

1+ year of experience in agile/lean project management with engineering teams (or similar roles). You understand modern software engineering practices and how to apply them to ensure continuous incremental delivery of user value. You know how to utilise metrics and agile ceremonies to continuously improve the way your team operates.

Remote work: You bring at least 6 months of experience working with distributed teams.

Technical skills: At least 2 years of experience crafting code in Clojure, Go, or another functional programming language.

Learning: You bias towards action, both in your own work, as well as in your enablement of others, and bring a drive to continuously help your team improve.

Communication and teamwork: You’re an effective communicator and collaborator. You thrive on building strong relationships with your teammates and stakeholders for your team.

We know there’s no such thing as an “ideal” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

About CircleCI

We are a globally distributed team working towards the common goal of being the standard bearer for continuous integration and deployment software. We are looking for people who are interested in helping us shape software engineering best practices for the industry as a whole.

CircleCI is the best platform for software teams looking to rapidly build quality projects, at scale. Our intelligent continuous integration and delivery tools are simple yet powerful. Our aim is to provide the wisdom of a connected development ecosystem to every team member making technology decisions.

We run 12M+ builds a month on our platform for companies like Spotify, Kickstarter, Sony, and Coinbase. Over 25,000 organizations and 300,000 developers actively build, test, and deploy on CircleCI. We’ve raised $59.5M in venture capital from Industry Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Harrison Metal Capital, and Baseline Ventures.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Senior Application Security Engineer
description:
CircleCI is looking for an experienced Application Security Engineer capable of advancing security across our entire platform–from our single-page web app to the containers in our build system. You will work closely with Software Engineering and SRE teams, bringing security in early in the life-cycle and working with engineers to build security from design through production.

What will make you successful:

Software development experience, interest and ability.

Proficiency in one or more of: Clojure, Go, Java, C#, C, C++, Ruby.

Deep understanding of the fundamentals of security at multiple layers of abstraction, from operating systems to applications.

Collaborative approach to mentoring software engineers on the development of secure code.

Passion for modern software development and operation, including agile, CI/CD, and infrastructure-as-code.

Experience with the specific security implications of operating in a cloud environment.

Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.

Enjoy flexibility in role and a desire to experiment with different approaches.

Excited by the ability to make significant impact in a growing company.

A strong desire for continuous improvement.

5+ years of experience in software, 2+ in security.

What you will do:

Support and advise software engineering teams in the design of secure software.

Design and deliver shared libraries and services to support security requirements within our platform.

Work with 3rd-party partners to manage our ongoing penetration testing program.

Recommend and deploy tooling to manage security in the delivery pipeline as well as production systems.

Engage with large customers as needed to advise them on security practices when deploying our solutions.

Diagnose and resolve security issues in conjunction with software engineering teams.

Participate in defining security-related end user features in the CircleCI product.

Working remotely at CircleCI

We’re a distributed company with teammates across the world. We can support you working remotely anywhere in Ireland, the UK or Germany.

title: Software Developer C++ for 3D maps (m,f,d)

title: Software Development Engineer I
description:
Cures Start Here. At Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, home to three Nobel laureates, interdisciplinary teams of world-renowned scientists seek new and innovative ways to prevent, diagnose and treat cancer, HIV/AIDS and other life-threatening diseases. Fred Hutch’s pioneering work in bone marrow transplantation led to the development of immunotherapy, which harnesses the power of the immune system to treat cancer. An independent, nonprofit research institute based in Seattle, Fred Hutch houses the nation’s first cancer prevention research program, as well as the clinical coordinating center of the Women’s Health Initiative and the international headquarters of the HIV Vaccine Trials Network. Careers Start Here.

Biostatistics, Bioinformatics and Epidemiology (BBE) at Fred Hutch is seeking a full-stack developer in the Gottardo Lab at the Fred Hutch to work on a cloud-enabled biomarker discovery and data exploration platform for immunological assay data applied to cancer immunotherapy and vaccine clinical trials. For more information about the lab, please see our web site at rglab.org.

Responsibilities

In collaboration with groups at the Fred Hutch we are building a biomarker discovery and screening tool to enable high throughput processing of large amounts of cytometry and immunological assay data collected through trials run by the Cancer Immunotherapy Trials Network, HIV Vaccine Trials Network, and others at the Fred Hutch.

The envisioned platform will be used to standardize, integrate and rapidly analyze data sets across studies. The platform will serve to streamline analysis and as a backbone on which to build novel computational algorithms, disseminate data for data sharing, visualization & exploration, with downstream analyses focusing on identification of potential correlates of outcome & biomarkers that could be leveraged to inform follow-up studies, stratify patients for therapy, or inform new vaccine designs.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate for the full-stack developer position would have expertise in web development, polyglot persistence, cloud infrastructure, and software engineering best practices. Experience working with systems integration is a plus.

Candidates should be fluent in Python and HTML5 and JavaScript, with experience in R or C++ preferred. Experience in languages such as Ruby, or Perl, or PHP are a plus. Candidates should also have excellent written and verbal communication skills. Interfacing with project collaborators in-person and online is a key aspect of the position.

To apply for the position please include:

  • your current resume
  • code samples or links to published/distributed code you've written, and
  • contact information for two references

title: Site Reliability Engineers
description:
CircleCI seeks Site Reliability Engineers who are excited about building a product that empowers thousands of developers to do better work every single day.

You'll work closely with our distributed, cross-functional engineering teams to deliver and manage the scalable, high-performance infrastructure of our Cloud and On-Premises offerings. You'll also build automation tools and help our software engineers design services that are optimized for scale.

You will have direct impact in the following ways:

Improving the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of CircleCI’s services.

Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, anticipating performance bottlenecks.

Partnering with other teams to diagnose and resolve production issues.

Architect and implement shared infrastructure used by all services within the CircleCI platform, for both SaaS and on-prem configurations

Supporting and advising other teams to help them craft scalable services.

Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring, and debugging

Planning and executing disaster recovery drills.

Participating in rotating on-call duties, including incident management, and helping us improve our processes

Do you love collaboration and teamwork? Are you eager to learn new things and help others learn, too? Are you a strong communicator in both synchronous and asynchronous mediums? If so, here’s the additional experience we’re looking for:

I6+ years of experience with distributed microservices environments.

Experience managing container-based architectures, including orchestration, service-discovery, monitoring, and debugging.

Understanding of standard networking protocols and components such as TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, and the OSI Model.

In-depth knowledge of operating system internals: processes, threads, IPC, concurrency, locks, mutexes, semaphores, etc.

Proficiency in one or more of: Python, Go, Java, C, C++

Comprehensive knowledge of Postgres, MongoDB, Redis.

Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive

Track-record of working cooperatively with software engineering teams

Focus on security in the delivery of all levels of a system

Passion for modern software development and operation, including agile, CI/CD, and infrastructure-as-code

We know there’s no such thing as an “ideal” candidate - we’re all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you’ll apply.

About CircleCI

CircleCI is the best platform for software teams looking to rapidly build quality projects, at scale. Our intelligent continuous integration and delivery tools are simple yet powerful. Our aim is to provide the wisdom of a connected development ecosystem to every team member making technology decisions.

We run 12M+ builds a month on our platform for companies like Spotify, Kickstarter, Sony, and Coinbase. Over 25,000 organizations and 300,000 developers actively build, test, and deploy on CircleCI. We’ve raised $59.5M in venture capital from Industry Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Harrison Metal Capital, and Baseline Ventures.

We are a globally distributed team working towards the common goal of being the standard bearer for continuous integration and deployment software. We are looking for people who are interested in helping us shape software engineering best practices for the industry as a whole.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Software meets eDrive Electrifying Insights @Mercedes-Benz Cars
description:
The future of mobility is electric, digital and intelligent - characteristics that EQ stands for at Mercedes-Benz.

EQ's portfolio includes all future battery-powered automobiles as well as the associated products and services from Mercedes-Benz. In the electrification of the powertrain, Mercedes-Benz is taking a holistic approach and developed the EQ brand with a vehicle family and an ecosystem that includes a comprehensive range of electric mobility products in addition to the vehicle itself. The EQ team invites you to Sindelfingen on May 11, 2019 and looks forward to taking a look into the future of Mercedes-Benz Cars together with you!

What awaits you?

Our EQ experts are looking forward to getting to know you at our event "Software meets eDrive" on May 11, 2019 in Sindelfingen. We want to discuss the electrifying future of Mercedes-Benz Cars with you and give you insights into our ideas and projects. In addition to pitches on current top topics, information stands and discussion forums, you will have the opportunity to talk to our experts from Research & Development in private to exchange ideas, challenges and fields of application in Stuttgart and Berlin.

Interested?

Our experts will be on site in Sindelfingen on May 11, 2019 and look forward to discussing the following topics with you:

▸ Software development eDrive

▸ Battery and cell development

Good to know

If your application is successful, we will invite you before May 4. We will cover the cost of travel to and from the event. If you are unable to attend on the day of the event, we will be happy to contact you by Skype or telephone.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Graphics Developer
description:
We are looking for a senior graphics developer to welcome in our central team in either London or Barcelona to help us push the graphical quality of our mobile games. Are you someone with experience of delivering scalable systems and do you like to work closely with amazingly skillful Artists to deliver beautiful results that push the boundaries of what people consider possible on mobile? If so, we’d really like to hear from you.

Your Role within our Kingdom

As part of the Central Art group:

  • You'll work alongside hardworking and passionate Artists and Technical Artists on key technologies to deliver cutting edge visuals that will be used across a variety of titles at King.
  • You will also work with key developers across King to share knowledge and top practices helping to ensure when a game is released, the visuals standout.
  • You will work in a highly visible role with the chance to make significant impact on the mobile games market.
  • You will be at the cutting edge of helping define and research the best techniques that allow the best use of the mobile GPU hardware.

Skills to Create Skills

  • You are a forward-thinker with a desire to help define the top practices on the rapidly evolving mobile GPU ecosystem.
  • You are curious and have the ability to learn quickly, and you love working closely with others to tear down the boundaries.
  • You are fascinated by GPU architecture and appreciate the growing opportunity this rapidly evolving landscape presents.
  • You possess excellent C++ knowledge
  • You have professional experience of game development
  • You hold experience in delivering scalable graphic solutions
  • You show a real passion for game development
  • You demonstrate high sense of quality and passion for all things graphical
  • You're a good communicator, with artist and programmers alike

Bonus Points

  • You have mobile GPU architecture knowledge
  • You have experience in generating procedural systems
  • You are experienced in working with Unity
  • You know a little about Android/OSX
  • You have tile-based GPU rendering knowledge

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

Making games is fun! Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.

Life at King

Officially, we are a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world. Unofficially, we’re a serious business that takes pride in having fun. Every single day at King, we mix intuition with logic, art with science and magic with mathematics to craft the games the world loves to play. Together with our parent company, Activision Blizzard, our mission is to bring moments of magic to everyday life. Do you think this is something you can help us achieve? Then we’d love to talk.

Comprehensive relocation package

People come from all over the world to work with us, and we want every single one of them to feel at home. To do so, you will receive as much help as we can give you with our relocation package. You can enjoy full visa sponsorship for you and any family member moving with you; you can see covered the cost your journey out here, of shipping your gadgets; and you can receive further help with estate agents.

title: Data Scientist Technical Lead
description:
We are looking for a talented and creative Data Scientist Technical Lead who is interested in pushing the boundaries of online games analytics, with a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioural or economic, practically in order to generate business value.

Your role within our Kingdom

The London Business Performance Unit is part of King London Studio, home to our live games - Farm Heroes Saga and Farm Heroes Super Saga as well as our new games in production, supporting King’s network of hundreds of millions of players. We are focused on building games that our players love. Reporting to the Business Performance Director of the London Business Performance Unit, you will lead a team of 4-6 Data Scientists of various tenure and Data Science Team Leads. You will be part of a community of 80+ business intelligence & analytics experts across King.

What you’ll do:

  • Analyse our games per business needs
  • Continuously develop your team’s skillset through the Data Science Team Lead, trainings, coaching, peer reviews and other means as you see fit
  • Proactively develop and define new analyses, experiments, data-driven tools, methodologies and best practices to advance data science methods within the team in order to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our games
  • Lead recruitment and onboarding of Data Scientists
  • Identify and oversee or handle data and technical issues and projects
  • Keeping up to date with industry and DS best practices, methodologies and evangelising with the team as relevant
  • Identify analysis that should be prioritised and work with stakeholders to prioritise it
  • Be part of King DS leadership forum, evangelise the team and connect the team to the wider DS community in King
  • Define the tech strategy including automation, tools preference, coding best practices, reusability and transferability
  • Support other London BPU team members from technical and methodology perspective Skills to create thrills

You have a passion for quantitative analysis and will have the ability to draw business insights which will add real value to King. You will need to demonstrate the ability to learn quickly and will have worked in a fast paced and collaborative environment. This role will involve working with teams and individuals within the studio and across King - such as Game Developers, Designers and Business Performance Managers, so excellent communication skills are essential.

Our ideal candidate will have solid experience leading an analytical team in a commercial environment.

Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and opportunities from a player and a business perspective, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions

Leadership: The ability to mentor, guide and inspire Data Scientists and drive best practices

SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players, and work effectively with big data technologies, e.g. BigQuery, Hadoop etc..

Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python (and also Excel) for analytical purposes

Stats: Understanding the appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques to use in different circumstances.

Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous

Bonus points

Specific experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes: experience in the games industry or similarly sophisticated customer-facing digital businesses; experience in behavioural psychology/economics; robust understanding of more advanced statistical techniques suitable for analysis of highly skewed populations; experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas; experience in experimental design; software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently); skills with standard reporting tools such as QlikView/Tableau/etc.

A great saga needs all sorts of heroes

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply can’t expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. And that’s it.

King in London

Based in bustling Soho, the cultural heart of the West End, our London studio occupies all four floors of the landmark Ampersand building. Regent’s Park is close enough for a lunchtime run, as are the delights of Covent Garden and the shopping mecca Oxford Street. Non-Brits will soon discover it’s no urban myth; there really is a pub on every corner.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
We are looking for a talented and creative Data Scientist interested in pushing the boundaries of games analytics within the Farm Heroes Franchise located in our London Game studio. You’ll have a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioural or economic, to generate value for the studio's new generation of awesome mobile games.

You will be working with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast-paced environment. You’ll help us to further understand, model, predict, segment and retain our players and be part of a community of 100+ business intelligence & analytics experts.

Specifically, you’ll:

  • Proactively develop new analyses, experiments and data-driven tools to better understand our players’ behaviour and the performance of our games
  • Provide insights to support decision making for the portfolio of games in the Studio
  • Translate business needs to technical requirements and AB-tests, and work with development teams to ensure correct implementation, taking care to correctly track the right information to allow easy, precise analysis of the impact
  • Work closely with other Data Scientists across the business to leverage insights from one game across multiple games
  • Carefully check, debug, and problem solve issues to ensure you deliver accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools, even when confronted by subtle data complications

There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.

Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:

  • Business Insight: The ability to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisions
  • Communication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualising or reporting your results/analysis so they are clear and unambiguous
  • SQL: The ability to write complex SQL queries to analyse our databases with 300+ million players and work with relational database systems.
  • Analytical coding: Using tools such as R, Python or Excel for analytical purposes
  • Stats: Understanding the basics of appropriate statistical or machine learning techniques.

Other experience that might be helpful, but is not required, includes:

  • Work in the games industry or similarly customer-facing digital businesses
  • Familiarity with massive data sets and tools to deal with them (BigQuery/AWS/Hadoop etc)
  • Experience in behavioural psychology/economics and experimental design
  • Experience in predictive analytics, segmentation, and related areas
  • Software engineering skills in Java and other languages (beyond R and Python which we use most frequently)
  • Skills with standard reporting tools such as Looker/QlikView/Tableau/etc.

We're Knights of Creativity

We believe that great gaming experiences happen when they are developed by working in small, autonomous creative teams that control the whole process - from idea to amazing game. Our close connection with the player community gets us instant feedback and enables us to deliver truly magical moments. We value your free time and your need to refuel, relax and find inspiration - by playing games with your colleagues, being at home with your family or going to the gym or out for a run. That's how we stay creative. That’s why we call ourselves developers of magic and knights of creativity! Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people that share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. No matter where you’re from, it’s all about what we can achieve together when creating truly magical moments for all our players. That’s why we hire all sorts of talent - because a great saga needs all sorts of heroes.

title: Next Big Thing - Recruiting Days Autonomous Driving and Artificial Intelligence
description:
Tasks

Is it your goal to create the Next Big Thing?

Do you immediately think of robotics, simulation platforms or software architecture? Or do you perhaps enjoy developing algorithms for autonomous systems, and programming with C/C++ and MATLAB/Simulink? Would you like to connect the vehicles of the future using cloud-based systems, and allow them to drive completely autonomously using machine learning?

Then you've come to the right place, because that is exactly what we are working on at Daimler in order to initiate a new era of mobility. Become part of this new mobility, and create your very own next big thing.

Do you have visions and ideas for how to revolutionize personal, goods or public transportation?

Then join us at the "Next Big Thing Recruiting Days Autonomous Driving and Artificial Intelligence at Daimler" on May 17 and 18 and find out what it means to work on the Next Big Thing at Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler Trucks and Daimler Buses.

An action-filled event awaits you:

  • In battles and pitches, Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler Trucks and Daimler Buses will attempt to win you for themselves.
  • You will have the opportunity to experience and discuss modern AI technology first-hand with our developers at driving events.
  • In a relaxed atmosphere, you will have the opportunity to discuss the Next Big Thing in the fields of autonomous driving and AI with your new colleagues.

Submit your application by April 29, 2019!

We have a wide range of exciting topics. Nevertheless, we need to know from you which topic your heart is beating for. So we can even better share our enthusiasm with you.

So please name 1-2 favourite subject areas in your application:

  • Software development in the area of sensor data processing and sensor fusion
  • Software development in the area of behavior generation/management, vehicle motion control and trajectory planning
  • Architecture development for high-performance embedded systems
  • Software development in the area of environment perception and machine & deep learning
  • Software & architecture development in the field of cloud computing, AI, data science and DevOps
  • Software development in the area of simulation and validation processes
  • Software Development in the area of localization/positioning

Qualifications

  • You have a degree in IT, electrical engineering, robotics, mechatronics, mathematics, physics or a comparable subject.
  • You have well-developed skills with programming languages (e.g. C, C++, Python, Java) and development/simulation tools (e.g. Matlab, Simulink, DOORS, Linux).
  • You ideally already have professional experience in the fields of automated driving, driver assistance systems or electronic vehicle systems.
  • We also expect excellent communication skills and that you enjoy working in a team, as well as the ability to always keep the bigger picture in mind.
how_to_apply: Create the next big thing and apply here!

title: Experte (m/w) für Testautomatisierung
description:
Unser Team 'Application Engineering Automation & Analytics' fokussiert sich auf die Automatisierung von Prozessen, wobei wir die gesamte Bandbreite von Testing bis hin zur Datenverarbeitung abdecken. Erstellung von Test-Konzepten und -Strategien auf Basis der bestehenden Testautomatisierungsmethodik.

Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Testautomatisierungs-Methode sowie unseres Testautomatisierungs-Frameworks basierend auf Java, Selenium, Appium.

Einbindung von neuen Technologien (KI, Cloud) sowie Trend-Scouting.

Koordination, Steuerung sowie Entwicklung bestehender kundenspezifischer Automatisierungsprojekte.

Akquise neuer Kundenprojekte sowie Übernahme der Projektverantwortung von der Angebotserstellung bis zum Projektabschluss.

Idealerweise Kenntnisse in der Android-/iOS-Entwicklung, der Testautomatisierung und der Java-Programmierung.

Selbständige und qualitätsbewusste Arbeitsweise, gutes analytisches Denkvermögen sowie die Fähigkeit zu konzeptionellem, ergebnis- und zielorientiertem Arbeiten.

Spaß an der Lösungsfindung von komplexen Problemen sowie Leidenschaft für neue Technologien.

Starke Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten sowie hohe Kundenorientierung.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer Mobile Apps (m/f/d)
description:
Our vision is DRIVING - AS SIMPLE AS LISTENING TO MUSIC.

Cluno is a new, flexible mobility concept: a digital car subscription. Car subscription works for anyone who wants to get around in his or her own car. We think all car-related processes completely digital and innovative. By this we help our customers finding the right mobility solution for their current life and needs and thus become their permanent partner. We work every day to make driving and changing cars as easy and convenient as possible. In order to meet this challenge, we are constantly looking for new talents who accompany us on our journey and strengthen our team.

To strengthen our growing QA team, we are looking for you at our Munich location as a

Quality Assurance Engineer Mobile Apps (m/f/d)

at the earliest possible date | permanent employment | full-time employment

An exciting task awaits you with us

Would you like to take responsibility for the quality of our native mobile products (iOS & Android)? In close collaboration with our QA lead you will be driving our mobile testing activities from the moment stories are written! You design, implement and execute testing plans and test automation, push a culture of QA best practices and work closely with our product managers and developers. Thereby you assure and improve our product quality and create a seamless user experience. Your tasks in detail:

  • Creation of an automated test environment to cover a variety of scenarios
  • Design, development and maintenance of frameworks for our test infrastructure
  • Work with cross functional agile teams and definition of testing strategies, criteria and processes
  • Keep a detailed eye on the feature development process, empower the teams to adopt QA mentality and speak up to prevent risks
  • Use creative and user-centered thinking to quickly identify and test edge cases for our applications
  • Definition of integration tests and evaluation of the quality level of every new app release
  • Discover and experiment with new test techniques and formats for continuous improvement

That's what Cluno is all about

  • Your impact: With your expertise and commitment you actively shape our growth.
  • Teamwork: Flexible, pragmatic, professional and solution-oriented; we have a great atmosphere - both at work and at our company events; we are currently over 60 experts and our team continues to grow.
  • Stable environment: Start up and solidly positioned; for our three founders, Cluno is already the second successful start-up; German and American investors have invested a total of over $36 million in us in one year.
  • Our office: Centrally located in Munich at Leuchtenbergring; here we offer you fruit and drinks for free and we have our own canteen and coffee bars in-house. The highlight is our roof terrace with a view of the Alps.
  • Benefits: e.g. subsidy for the MVV ticket or employee discount for our Cluno Auto subscription.

You bring this with you as Quality Assurance Engineer Mobile Apps (m/w/d)

  • At least 2 years of manual and automated testing experience on Android and iOS
  • Proven experience in mobile test automation, cloud based testing environments and with common testing frameworks (e.g. Appium or Calabash)
  • Hands-on with mobile programming languages such as Java, Kotlin, Swift and Objective-C
  • Experience in writing, executing and validating tests across a wide test spectrum (functional, non-functional, regression, integration, performance, security etc.)

  • Motivation to work with agile/scrum development methodologies
  • Marked commitment to quality and self-responsibility as well as comfortable interaction and collaboration in cross functional engineering and product teams
  • Fluent in written and spoken English and German just like good communication skills

Sounds exciting?

title: Senior PHP Developer
description:
Build and improve a product that helps companies attract more qualified applicants, using a data-driven recommendation engine, that’s what Engineering at VONQ does. We are a growing organization in the transition to a software-driven business, and YOU can make an impact on that! You are a true PHP expert and you get excited when it comes to practices such as domain driven design, event sourcing & CQRS. Sounds like you? Apply now at VONQ for the position of Senior Software Engineer in Rotterdam!

Senior PHP Developer

Rotterdam, 32-40 hr, ASAP

Your every day in a nutshell

You start your day with your colleagues around the team board discussing what the goal for today should be. It seems that having the backend endpoint ready for the new API is tops, so you get down to it.

After a small design conversation, it's clear that some refactoring needs to happen, as our understanding of the problem improved. No worries! You're ready to pair up and have that PR before lunch.

In the afternoon you have a one-on-one with the CTO, Bart, and you discuss to which industry-related event you'd like to go next. Perhaps you dare to give a presentation this time?

After that, you get to check some Pull Requests made by your colleagues and before the day ends, that endpoint is building, deploying and sending the right metrics! Today's been a good day, now ready to go home.

How you get the job done

  • PHP is your native language and you use Symfony, MySQL and Elasticsearch
  • You’ll work in a multidisciplinary team: pairing, code reviews and giving/receiving feedback is something you’ll do regularly
  • Your job includes more than only coding, that’s why you’ll work closely together with the Product Manager & Business stakeholders to actually give direction to the things you build
  • Since you get a lot of space and freedom for new initiatives, you turn good ideas into actions. For example, improving or implementing things you find important or interesting on the spot!

You will be part of an international and experienced Engineering department consisting of Frontend- and Backend Developers, Data- and DevOps Engineers, an Agile Coach and a CTO.

What our perfect picture looks like

This describes the ideal candidate, but above all, we value people that are eager to grow, autonomous, work together, and love to get things done! Furthermore, we think you need:

  • 5+ year working experience as a PHP expert and an Agile mindset
  • Experience with MySQL
  • Experience with practices such as Domain Driven Design, Test-driven Development, Continuous- Integration, Deployment & Delivery
  • Excellent English communication skills
  • A passion for software architecture & craftsmanship

Bonus points:

  • Experience with event sourcing and CQRS
  • Experience with Symfony and Elasticsearch
  • Experience with REST API design and API based business
  • Experience as Scrum Master or team lead

There is more! We offer:

  • A good salary and 8% holiday allowance
  • 100% commuting expenses compensation
  • Flexible working hours
  • Unlimited (paid!) holidays
  • Pension contribution
  • Time and budget for training, and more!

Oh, and we have legendary company outings, beers on Friday and a lot of FUN!

Are you ready to make an impact and build together with us on a dream product for recruitment marketing? We can’t wait for your application!

Apply for Senior Software Engineer at VONQ in Rotterdam by clicking on this link. Questions? Reach out to Sarah (Recruiter) -> sarahellithy@vonq.com.

Agencies hold your horses: unsolicited CV’s are dropped by our SPAM filters.

title: Product Manager
description:

Who you are

What you’ll do

title: ***Ionic / Angular Developer***
description:
Educator.com is a video based learning website popular amongst high school and college students. We are currently in the process of launching a new open learning system and are looking to improve our current mobile app.

We are looking for experienced developers to creating pixel-perfect web pages and/or apps using Ionic / Angular.

You will be working remotely but engage in continuous periods of development and testing of the code with our team. All work and progress will be updated on our GitHub repo for the team to review.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

We have 3 concurrently ongoing projects you can choose from.

  • Project #1: The first project is for completing the open learning platform, where teachers can create their own courses and post video lectures and other lesson material. The basic framework of the site is in progress, and your job will be to build on the existing code and complete all the features. The site is at https://opencourse.educator.com. Login access will be provided for you upon request.

  • Project #2: The second project is to complete the login, signup and subscription features in our mobile app (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.educator.app, https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.educator.app). After that the open learning platform mentioned above will be added to the app. You will also have a lot of opportunities for improving and adding features to the app.

  • Project #3: The third project is restructuring our company Wordpress blogs. Educator.com currently have the following Wordpress blogs and we need to merge all of them together into a single Wordpress.

https://www.educator.com/news/ https://www.educator.com/studyguide/ https://www.educator.com/college-reviews/

  • https://www.educator.com/charter-schools/
  • https://www.educator.com/study-abroad/
  • https://www.educator.com/technology/
  • https://www.educator.com/student-finance/

It's your job to analyze the content structure and decide best to merge all the blogs. We will provide you the final Wordpress theme in image form, you will create the theme and merge all of our current blogs. The fix payout for this project is $2,300USD + additional bonuses

All 3 projects are on GitHub; you will be provided access, and all your changes will be reviewed there. You will install the existing code and framework on your local system and test all changes there before pushing to the repo. Both projects are built on Ionic 3 with Angular, with a PHP backend, using the aMember membership system hosted on the main www.educator.com site.

Please send links with examples of any relevant projects you've worked on as well as your resume.

Independent developers are preferred. Companies/agencies, please excuse.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Experience with the Ionic/Angular framework as well as HTML, CSS, JS and PHP.
  • Knowledge or experience of video upload and processing.
  • Ability to create quick-responding complex user interfaces.
  • Creative solutions to improve the user experience.
  • Some knowledge or experience of progressive web apps.
  • Attention to detail

JOB BENEFITS:

  • Your contribution will be massively felt by students on Educator.com.
  • You will work directly with the founder and senior developers of the company.
  • Financial compensation can be paid by hourly, fixed or by salary depending on the collaborative chemistry.
  • No corporate BS and politics.
  • Freedom to do your thing and work remotely from anywhere and set your own hours.

You can apply for this opportunity here only: https://www.educator.com/careers/ionic
how_to_apply: Visit Educator's Jobs Page and apply for the Ionic / Angular Developer position

title: Mid- to Senior-level Vue.js Developer
description:
About the Position

Do you have solid Vue.js chops and are looking to put them to the test on a complex, large-scale project? Do you want to contribute to and develop architectural solutions from the ground-level? If you love making things work seamlessly and efficiently with one another, then we’re looking for you! We’re looking for a mid- to senior-level Vue.js Developer to be a key player in one of our company’s most critical initiatives, our platform conversion to Vue.js. You’ll be a vital resource on our highly-collaborative Development team, building robust scalable solutions that push the limits and can handle an endless supply of data that’s consumed by many different websites, client apps, mobile apps, Alexa, customers, vendors, etc. in real-time.

Job responsibilities include:

-Works within a highly collaborative team with senior members of our team, including our CTO, to develop a large-scale Vue.js application.

-Solves architectural challenges for a large-scale application involving a high-level of customer configurability, multiple user-types, multi-language support and more by conducting research on and experiments with alternate solutions to present recommendations.

-Designs and develops high-quality code that exhibits excellent performance, meets product requirements, and focuses on scalability and maintainability.

-Shows excellent judgment in architecting and planning applications and features at all stages of the project lifecycle.

-Interacts effectively with senior members of our team to determine project needs and develop solutions.

-Takes overall accountability for keeping the project clean and organized. This includes identifying next steps, clarifying unclear tasks, and breaking larger tasks into smaller and more manageable tasks.

-Exercises a sense of ownership to get things done. Do whatever it takes to make things happen and proactively gives advance warning if things aren’t going well so we can arrange for help.

-Constantly improves software quality (evaluate and incorporate new libraries, tools, and technologies; code reviews; refactoring; testing; etc.).

About You

-5+ years of development experience.

-2+ years with Vue.js with proven experience working on multiple complex projects.

-2 to 3 years of experience with application design/architecture.

-Previous experience working across JavaScript frameworks a plus.

-Demonstrates EXEMPLARY communication skills (both written and verbal).

-Fluent in English.

-An EXTRAORDINARY creative and analytical problem solver.

-Possesses and demonstrates PHENOMENAL overall technical expertise.

-Demonstrates a sense of urgency.

-Self-motivated, has a love for learning and new technology, and able to lead and mentor others.

-Experience with unit and end-to-end testing.

-IMPECCABLE attention to detail.

-Familiar with Agile development methodologies.

-Experience working on a B2B SaaS platform within a startup environment preferred.

Experience on the following is a plus:

-Nuxt.js -Documenting code and APIs.

-Code quality/unification (ESLint / Prettier).

-Code optimization and performance.

-Developing cross-platform applications.

We’d love it if you develop/contribute to open source!

What BuildingLink Can Offer You

-Opportunities to learn and advance your career

-Office culture comparable to the fast-pace, energy, and vibrancy of a startup, while maintaining the feel of a family owned company

-Competitive salary

-Medical/Dental/Commuter Benefits

-401k with matching

-Flexible PTO

-Birthday Holiday

-Team outings (happy hours, company events & retreats, weekly lunches, holiday parties, etc.)

About Us

BuildingLink is an industry leading property management technology used by over 4,800 high-rise residential communities globally. As an industry pioneer and leading innovator, our solutions, service, and people have made us one of the most recognized and respected technology providers among property managers and staff, condo/coop boards, and landlords. Our roadmap is packed with new and exciting initiatives to help buildings run even better. Resident lifestyle, voice assistant with our Amazon Alexa Skill; Ledger for simplified property management accounting, more platform integrations, and IoT sensor solutions to target and solve buildings’ operational headaches are just a few of the key initiatives we have in the pipeline. So, if you’re looking to work for a dynamic and successful company that cares deeply for both its customers and employees, please apply!

BuildingLink is an equal opportunity employer to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, disability, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected class by federal, state or local law.

title: Frontend Developer (f/m/d)
description:
#SPORTSFREUNDE

BEWERBEN SICH BEI DECATHLON

You will support the UX team with your sense of good design and UX, bringing your creativity to bear on various projects and taking on a range of interdisciplinary tasks. You will improve our different digital channels on an ongoing basis through your work in development and design. You will work at our headquarters in Plochingen (near Stuttgart).

Be a part of our success story in Plochingen (near Stuttgart) as our new

Frontend Developer (f/m/d)

As Frontend Developer you will be responsible for ...

  • implementing modern front-end principles through open web standards and modern web technology to ensure the best user experience across different end devices.

  • optimising our digital channels and maintaining ongoing exchange with our international teams.

You are ...

  • motivated by challenges and teamwork.

  • good at communicating, with good to very good English skills. German is not a must have.

We are looking forward to receiving your application, with a selection of your best work.

Apply now via the application form or at: www.decathlon-karriere.de

title: Web and UI Developer
description:
Web and UI Developer 1133 Connecticut Ave NW, Washington, DC 20036, USA Full-time

Company Description

RockCreek is a leading global investment management firm that applies data-driven technology and innovation to investing. Its portfolio managers invest in emerging markets and alternatives, and its asset allocation teams invest in multi-asset class and outsourced CIO portfolios and customized solutions. RockCreek’s client base is made up of sophisticated institutional investors, including endowments, foundations, pension plans, and sovereign funds. The firm is highly focused on the integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors and sustainable impact across portfolios to generate long-term returns. RockCreek has a culture of diversity, debate and relentless drive to excel.

While our core competency is investment, we value our technology as a key part of our service offerings. We are currently redesigning our website to use best-of-breed technologies and a staging and production platform. We also have a growing suite of applications that will need a unified, consistent, and user-focused approach to UX and UI.

Job Description

RockCreek is looking for a Web and UI Designer to provide a meaningful connection between the company’s public-facing website, internal Intranet, and suite of applications. This role will be responsible for recommending and implementing a web CMS solution, designing and implementing both a staging and production version of a new company website, developing a company Intranet presence, and working with the engineering team to provide consistent designs and front-ends across all of our applications. This will role also frequently communicate with users and stakeholders of our various applications.

The successful Web and UI Developer should:

  • Enjoy the process of visual and material design, as well as implementing those designs in responsive HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
  • Model user’s behavior with wireframes and mockups using creative and modern best practices and design patterns
  • Be fluent in modern web abstractions for CSS and JavaScript, and desire to grow in an understanding and usage of JavaScript in particular

Although travel is not expected to be frequent, the Web and UI Developer should be able to occasionally meet onsite with clients and, if not located in the Washington, D.C. area, meet with the team for in-person planning sessions.

Qualifications

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or similar, or equivalent professional experience
  • At least 3 years experience as a web, UI, or UX developer
  • Understanding of user-centered design methods, including portfolio of sites you have designed or co-designed that demonstrate attention to user workflows in addition to static design
  • Experience with a major CMS, such as Wordpress, ideally in a multi-staged environment (testing, staging, production, etc.)
  • Fluency in best practices for information architecture and design
  • Experience with Jira or Pivotal Tracker
  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills

Desired Skills:

  • Past application development using React and/or Vue.js, preferably in the context of single-page applications
  • Practical experience performing user studies or documenting user workflows for implementation in web applications
  • AWS or Google Cloud experience
  • Experience in investment applications or working with the investment and/or financial industry

Interested?

Please apply by using the 'Apply' button.

Additional Information

RockCreek is a collaborative environment that values openness, transparency, partnership, and knowledge sharing. In a typical day you will interact with members of all of our teams; engineering is neither siloed nor cut off from the overall RockCreek business. You should be both interested and capable of learning the investment business as it relates to engineering, and creatively looking to enhance the overall RockCreek service offerings.

Agency calls are not appreciated.

title: Software engineer
description:
Want to touch the lives of millions of customers around the world, turning their digital customer journey into a fantastic ride? Then join our global engineering team.

Our apps are used by millions of customers all over the globe, multiple times a day. We’re looking for experienced software engineers who can help turn their digital journey into a fantastic ride.

We’re on a mission

More and more people live their lives on digital platforms. And although competition is fierce, this is where we want to be. We want to be part of people’s lives, helping them make better decisions. Become the go-to-place for their financial matters. What will this platform of ours look like? We’re building it right now. And that’s where you come in.

What you’ll be working on

We work on high-performing, scalable, innovative, multi-channel applications that make our customers smile with every interaction.

We have positions available in teams that are working to improve our mobile banking app, our internet banking web app, global continuous deployment pipelines, generic web components libraries, cross-channel employee portals and much more. We’d love to know in which ING team you’d like to add value.

As a full stack software engineer, you’ll work in an international environment in one of our multidisciplinary squads. Together with business colleagues, UX designers, visual designers and product owners you’ll be building our next generation banking applications.

What you’ll get in return

  • The chance to work in a global, innovation-driven company that loves tech.

  • An international and diverse network of the best engineering talents.

  • Many opportunities to test yourself, learn and grow.

  • An agile, vibrant and flexible work environment.

  • Great work-life balance.

  • A competitive salary and excellent benefits, like a 13th month, pension scheme, personal allowance, laptop, mobile phone.

What you bring

We’re looking for creative, open-minded junior, mid-level and senior engineers who:

  • Love solving technical and functional challenges.

  • Quickly grasp new technical concepts, also outside of their comfort zone.

  • Know what it’s like to work in multidisciplinary teams and embrace the agile way of working.

  • Have great analytical skills and conceptual / architectural understanding.

  • Follow software development trends and technology in general, and enjoy sharing what they know with the rest of the organisation.

  • Have strong social and communication skills (fluently speak and write English)

Your tech stack

  • A proven track record and proficiency in software development.

  • For back end think about JVM-based with a focus on Java, Spring, Maven, Jenkins, Sonar, Cassandra, Oracle.

  • For front end: Polymer, Angular, Web components, Redux, NPM.

  • Knowledge about databases, VMs, docker and cloud patterns are an advantage.

  • Experience with (test) automation, continuous delivery, deployment tools and pipelines. We work with Tomcat, Jenkins, Nolio, SonarQube, Fortify, Artifactory, Selenium among others.

Interested? Let’s chat

To find out more, hit the link! and share your CV. We’ll be in touch.

title: Web Application Developer/Drupal Developer
description:
At the Howard Hughes Medical Institute (HHMI), creativity and excellence are fundamental to our success. As one of the world's largest philanthropies, HHMI is a major force in advancing biomedical research and science education in the U.S. and beyond. We have an exciting opportunity for a web developer working in the Information Technology department at our Headquarters in Chevy Chase, Maryland. This is a full-time position.

At our headquarters, we provide space for collaboration and interaction beyond your office – sunlit rooms, artwork, beautiful grounds, gyms with classes, snacks, and, of course, smart people and innovative work all around…not to mention free coffee!

We invest in people, not projects. As such, the organization is committed to helping our employees grow. The development team has access to a variety professional development options including training programs, courses, and conferences, to name a few.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Web Application Development, the web application developer must know Drupal inside and out with experience taking complex page designs and building out the required content types, frontend HTML/CSS/JS, and even writing custom modules as needed. The developer should be very familiar with commonly used Drupal modules, and understand the basic architecture for Drupal sites. Our clients appreciate high attention to detail when translating designs to code, so we prefer developers who have an eye for common user experience and design issues that crop up on both desktop and mobile implementations.

You will work alongside a skilled team of other web developers, and will collaborate with them on projects, following Agile/Scrum methodologies. Code reviews, quality assurance, and user-acceptance testing are all part of our process to ensure high caliber results.

Qualifications

Education:

BS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or information technology.

Experience:

2+ of hands-on experience with Drupal 7/8. 5+ years of web development experience. Strong fluency in PHP. Experience with source control systems, such as Git. Demonstrated proficiency of HTML/CSS/JS, with technologies such as LESS/SAAS, Bootstrap, Node/NPM/Gulp, and Angular/React. Experience with at least two other programming languages.

Please include links to source control or websites in your application to showcase your coding experience and skills.
