title: Frontend Developer
description:
Vi søker utvikler til Telenor Software Lab Trondheim!

Elsker du å programmere og ser etter nye utviklingsmuligheter? Vil du være med å videreutvikle en tjeneste over en million mennesker bruker? Vi søker utvikler som ønsker og jobbe med den kjente skytjenesten "Min Sky"!

Informasjon om stillingen Telenor Software Lab i Trondheim utvikler Telenors tjeneste “Min Sky” for skylagring av bilder og video. Tjenesten har over en million brukere og er en sentral del av Telenors satsing på digitale tjenester. Telenor Software Lab er posisjonert for å levere flere slike tjenester, og utviklingsteamet er stadig i vekst.

Vi har et spennende fagmiljø der vi jobber med et bredt spekter av oppgaver, fra maskinlæring og bildegjenkjenning til utvikling av gode brukergrensesnitt. Det er fokus på brukeropplevelse, og vi gjennomfører undersøkelser ute blant faktiske brukere for å finne ut hva som fungerer.

Til sammen teller vi i dag 31 stk på kontoret, hvor vi har en flott variasjon i nasjonaliteter og aldre. Teamet du vil jobbe på består i dag av fire stk. Vi bruker scrum som arbeidsmetodikk, og jobber derfor både selvstendig og i team. I starten får du tett oppfølging og opplæring. Vi forventer ikke at du skal kunne alt fra før og hos oss får du hjelp til å kvalitetssikre ditt arbeid, når vi har daglige code-reviews.

Hos oss vil du ha påvirkningskraft og rom for å komme med forslag. På sikt kan du få mer ansvar, samt få muligheten til å lære flere teknologier om du ønsker det.

Vi tilbyr

  • Utviklingsmuligheter og egenutviklingsprogram tilpasset den enkelte ansatte
  • Spennende fagmiljø
  • Interessante og utfordrende oppgaver
  • Valgfritt verktøy/utstyr til arbeidet
  • Svært godt arbeidsmiljø og moderne lokaler
  • Goder som ekstra ferie, fri kantine, dekt andel av foreldrepermisjon, telefon/internett mm.
  • Konkurransedyktige vilkår
  • Fleksibel arbeidstid, med kjernetid fra 0930-1500

Arbeidsoppgaver

  • Videreutvikle Min Sky sine tjenester
  • Implementere nye features
  • Noe vedlikehold

Vi søker deg som

  • Erfaring med utvikling av skytjenester
  • Ferdigheter innen React og TypeScript
  • Fordel med relevant utdanning på høyskolenivå

Hos oss er dine personlige egenskaper like viktig som dine tekniske programmeringskunnskaper! Faktisk er det aller viktigste for oss at du virkelig liker å programmere, bryr deg om brukeropplevelser og har et ønske om å utvikle deg som utvikler. Når vi jobber i team er samarbeid en egenskap vi setter høyt, og vi ønsker gjerne deg som er fremoverlent og tørr å gjøre feil, samtidig som du er selvstendig og ansvarsfull.

Rekrutteringsprosessen utføres av Academic Work på vegne av Telenor. Ta kontakt med Mari Helland for spørsmål! Søknadsfrist 22.04.19!

Informasjon om bedriften Telenor Software Lab designer, utvikler og drifter digitale tjenester både for Telenor og direkte mot sluttkunder. Vårt største produkt er "Min Sky", en skylagringstjeneste for bilder og video. Tjenesten har over en million brukere og er en sentral del av Telenors satsing på digitale tjenester. Telenor Software Lab er posisjonert for å levere flere slike tjenester, og utviklingsteamet er stadig i vekst. Vi har i dag 31 ansatte og holder til på Brattørkaia i Trondheim.

title: FullStack Developer
description:
FullStack developer / DevOps

Metrological is quickly growing (inter-)nationally and therefore we are looking for expansion of our current team with a FullStack developer / DevOps.

What will you do?

  • The daily activities range from data modeling to implementation, from web sockets to server architecture and the resolution of possible production problems.
  • As a FullStack developer / Dev Ops you work with different techniques, such as NodeJS, Linux, Nginx, Redis, ElasticSearch, MySQL and AngularJS.

What we are looking for?

  • Bachelor or master’s degree in computer science or similar technical area is a must;
  • Relevant experience as a full stack developer / dev op is a must;
  • Extensive experience with Javascript, Linux en MySQL is a must;
  • Experience with NodeJS, Redis, nginx en ElasticSearch is a plus;
  • You have an excellent command of the English language, in word and in writing;
  • Furthermore, you are accurate, structured and a team player, who is able to work independently and take on responsibilities.

Our dedicated team working in a tech-challenging environment:

You will become a part of the development team (consisting of 40 dedicated team members, including App Developers, Testers, Graphic Designers and Backend / Framework Developers) and are responsible for the development and maintenance of all backend services for our TV Appstore and associated TV Applications.

The Appstore is continuously under development as we are glad to supply innovative products to our customers. In addition to innovation, the challenge lies mainly in the code-technical aspect and the maintenance of the cloud architecture. There is an extensive cloud architecture with> 99.99% uptime that serves more than 100TB of data per month worldwide and has to handle 2500 requests per second at peak times.

Why are we the best company to currently work?

  • Metrological is a very innovative and dynamic company in the TV industry.
  • The office is located in the heart of Rotterdam and can best be described as a modern and inspiring work environment with an informal but professional atmosphere.
  • With a close-knit team of over 60 young and ambitious employees, the company works daily on the (continued) development of the Appstore for TV operators.
  • Metrological is growing fast so the internal (growth) possibilities are virtually unlimited. We offer you a position in which you can relinquish your creativity and work on the product of the future. You work in an inspiring environment with the latest equipment, so you can get the best out of yourself.

Apply?

Do you want to contribute to the success of Metrological? Send your resume via this link and we get in touch with you within 2 working days.

title: Senior Backend PHP Developer (Laravel)
description:
Be a part of an exciting journey

At Cobiro we're using machine learning and AI to build the next generation of online advertising experiences. We're on a mission to make online marketing accessible, trivial and high-performing for everyone, and we're starting with Google Ads.

Working at Cobiro, you’ll join a flat and agile organisation where bright ideas are appreciated and implemented regardless of seniority or area of specialization. We’re ambitious and work hard, but also know how to let loose and celebrate our accomplishments. At Cobiro you will meet different nationalities and personalities. We have common denominators: We are self-starters and team-players, love to solve problems, and we create high quality solutions.

We offer:

  • Flexible working hours
  • An agile work environment
  • Focus on quality solutions
  • Options to attend relevant courses and conferences
  • A team of passionate, skilled and experienced colleagues
  • All the gear and food you need: breakfast on Fridays, lunch every day, sodas, sparkling water, fruit, vegetables, sweets...
  • Frequent social company activities, Friday bar included
  • Good working equipment
  • A great working location at Esplanaden, Central Copenhagen

PHP Backend Developer (Laravel)

You will join a company where quality is valued: We know it sometimes takes time creating something great, and even if we do have deadlines we prefer a good product to quick launching. This means, you will work independently and take responsibilities of your own projects, and you can use your knowledge and curiosity to build something great.

You will be joining a skilled tech team consisting of backend developers working within the Laravel framework. We practice daily stand-ups, 14 day sprints, and work within smaller teams. We can offer an agile working environment: we collaborate across departments as well, for example AI, QA, Frontend, or Product Management.

For this position, you will need:

  • Excellent PHP coding skills and solid experience in Laravel
  • Substantial PostgreSQL/MySQL experience
  • Experience with data integration, web services & APIs
  • Proficient in GIT, and knowledgeable of CI principles
  • Sharp analytical mind with the ability to break down requirements and problems into smaller pieces

title: Senior Full-stack Developer (Firebase, node, react)
description:
Mothership engineering team is working towards Exchange product release. You have an excellent opportunity to jump on-board and join us on this exciting journey. Here is the portrait of a person we’re looking for.

You agree that JavaScript has won the war, at least for now. It’s your favorite tool, and you mastered it while making apps and web servers for years. Your favorite front-end framework is React.js. You can use it in different variations depending on a task and a project size. You are an expert in node.js. You know it’s architecture, and you don’t hesitate to use a profiler to improve the performance of a service. You’re following best development practices. Your code is nice and clean, and you can be on the same page with your teammates about this.

You passed through times of manual deployments and now enjoy the era of Docker containers. However, you prefer to be serverless. Although you can spin up any services and self-manage them, you're more happy with using managed cloud solutions. You love Firebase. You can tell us at least a couple of stories how did it help you to solve a business problem in hours instead of days and weeks. You’re not trying to dump QA responsibility on someone else. You agree that testing is a developer’s responsibility. You are proud of your typical above 95% test coverage. You can organize CI/CD flow and push a constant stream of features and patches to a staging environment, then to the production.

We are all constantly learning, but that’s not your first reason for joining us. You come here, first and foremost, to add another solid mark in your track record of successful projects. You listen to business needs and can evaluate priorities. You don’t want to be micromanaged. You are feature and delivery oriented. You are keen to make a great product. If all the above is about you, please double check the requirements and responsibilities below, add your cover letter and apply.

Requirements:

Five years of production experience in apps and web servers development; Expert knowledge in node.js and react.js; Confident UI development with HTML and CSS; A track record of projects built with Firebase and other serverless tools; Experience building scalable APIs which is able to handle high-volume traffic; Experience working in a startup environment; A strong team player with excellent communication skills; Ability to hack things together quickly;

Responsibilities:

Improve, add new features and build new software solutions for Mothership; Design and implement APIs to integrate Mothership’s products with internal and external services; Optimize development process by bringing best practices and improving CI/CD pipeline; Own and deliver maintainable, well-tested code.

Apply on Lever - https://jobs.lever.co/mothership/e70325f2-f6c8-4111-a590-2ef1e1a2724d

title: Senior/Lead Backend Developer (m/f/d)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

As a (Senior) Backend Developer, you contribute to building the backend system of Taledo's platform, which includes development but also infrastructure tasks. You are a significant part of Taledo Team and you take initiative to support your colleagues’ and your own development process within the organization.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

You design, develop and maintain Taledo’s backend services/APIs. You build sustainable code and take full responsibility over parts of the backend infrastructure. You have direct impact on the product and you see your code used live within days after joining. You implement the product requirements and cover it by test cases. You may also have the possibility of working on frontend related tasks on a case-by-case basis. You directly report to and work with the CTO.

ABOUT YOU

Minimum 5 years of experience with Rails 4 and exposure to other relevant backend technologies Relevant university degree and solid track record of academic and professional and/or personal achievements. Thorough mindset, you never think in best cases. Efficient and pragmatic working style, mastering your IDE and tooling. Willingness to work in agile environment. Experience with HTML5, CSS and JS frameworks is a plus.

YOUR ENVIRONMENT

At Taledo you will work with a highly motivated team in a truly international atmosphere. We provide a professional environment that allows you to stay focused but also leaves room for creativity. Open and honest communication on all levels is important to us. We are always open to constructive feedback and expect the same from you. Knowledge sharing and constant learning are pillars of our culture hence we give you the opportunity to work on interesting side projects and develop your core or non-core competencies. We offer responsibility from the start in a flat hierarchy environment with a doer & maker mindset. We provide breakfast, sweet and salty snacks, fruits and drinks. We organize regular team events and keep the atmosphere in the office very casual and friendly. We have flexible working hours and offer additional vacation entitlement for every year you are part of Taledo. Our office and the team is pet friendly.

title: Linux and Network Cloud Systems Engineer
description:
ThinxNet is a young company from Munich, living the Internet of Things vision. With our product ryd, we’re able to connect cars with the internet in a simple and fast way. Given our system, consisting of a hardware plug and a smartphone app, customers can get mobile access to relevant on-board information of their automobiles, pay at the gas station with just one click on their smartphone – without lining up in the shop – and much more. In addition, consumers have the chance to collect ryd by participating in marketing campaigns. Later on, these bonus points can be converted to premiums. Our long-term goal is to create a completely new mobility experience within the connected car and furthermore making vehicles smarter than ever before.

Your tasks

  • Being responsible for the installation and maintenance of our Linux based servers and and container swarms
  • Supporting and monitoring the Linux environment as well as testing and troubleshooting of software and hardware problems in the environment
  • As part of the infrastructure team, analyze cloud architecture implementations and make recommendations regarding security, network design and storage utilization
  • Work with the team to automate management tasks, streamline processes and perform standard administration functions as needed

Your Qualifications

  • Solid experience with maintenance, monitoring, high availability and backups
  • Working knowledge in IT automation/orchestration software like SaltStack is a plus
  • Working knowledge of containerization solutions such as Docker and orchestration solutions such as Kubernetes is a plus

What we offer

  • Learn from our experienced team, investors and advisors
  • Attractive role in the development of our growing service
  • Competitive salary
  • Great workplace
  • No politics, quick decisions in a well-funded start-up

Ready to revolutionize the automotive industry?

Then submit your CV and a short note why and when you want to join us to jobs@thinxnet.com. If you have any questions, feel free to give us a call or just stop by at our office. We really look forward to getting to know you!

Contact

Christoph Geiser Head of Software Development

ryd.one |thinxnet.com | ThinxNet GmbH Blutenburgstr. 18 | 80636 München | Tel.: +49 89 4520663-0

Special Instructions for Headhunters (only):

  • This is a permanent position - no freelancers are currently considered.
  • Please carefully read the job description.
  • Please send the matching CVs to the relevant job advertisement.
  • We are happy to review anonymized CVs - we will get back to you if the CV is interesting. If not then please do not expect an answer.
  • Please only send CVs which match the job description. If a job is not posted here, then there is no need to send a CV or call.
  • If you are not a headhunter and happen to read this, but rather look for a job, then please ignore the above lines: we are happy to receive your call and we will for sure provide feedback on your application :-)

location: Anywhere but able to work on European time zone
title: Front End Developer for new sustainability platform
description:
You are a Front End Developer wanting to join a small team and make a contribution to social and environmental impact at the same time as build a commercially successful company.

We are looking for a freelance developer to join our team developing the www.oneplanet.com platform. The company is a for-profit enterprise which has been set up by leading not-for-profit, Bioregional www.bioregional.com.

In order to take our platform to the next level, our User Interface Designer is creating many new UI design files. Before implementing these designs in the back-end of the platform, we need a front-end developer to take the ADOBE XD files and code them in HTML / CSS / Material UI static web pages.

Therefore, we are looking for a developer who has 2 or 3 years experience at least in coding clean HTML, CSS3, responsive design and who has also experience in using Photoshop or similar image editor tools in order to collaborate with our UI designer. You will also need to have some experience of working with existing libraries like Material UI or Bootstrap.

We work on European timezones but could have some flexibility. Initial contract will be for 6 months but will be extended for the right applicant.

We are an equal opportunities company and would particularly welcome applications from women developers.

Please send your CV and short covering note to richard.edwards@oneplanet.com along with your remuneration expectation. Please state country in which you are based.
how_to_apply: Please email you CV with a couple of sentences on why you want to join our team, to richard.edwards@oneplanet.com

title: Java developer / DevOps Engineer
description:
Heb jij (ruime) ervaring met applicatie ontwikkeling, testen en onderhoud en ben jij toe aan een nieuwe uitdaging? Kom jij als ervaren engineer te werken voor ons Agile Devops team dat zich bezig houdt met business kritische applicaties?

CGI heeft voor haar locatie in Rotterdam een vacature voor een Java developer / DevOps Engineer

Wat ga je doen als Jave Developer / DevOps Engineer? Als ervaren DevOps applicatie engineer houd jij je bezig met het vertalen van stakeholder requirements (functionele en niet-functionele) naar functioneel/technisch ontwerp en naar test ontwerp. Jij ontwikkelt applicatie- en test software (ontwerp, bouw en test). Daarnaast automatiseer jij systeem- en integratie testen (voorbereiden, uitvoeren en beheer/onderhoud) en voer jij applicatie onderhoud en support uit. Het oplossen van incidenten en waakdienst kan onderdeel zijn van de opdracht.

Wat breng je mee

  • Je bent analytisch sterk en denkt in oplossingen. Ook ben je proactief en resultaat gedreven. Je hebt ruime ervaring met agile werken en werkomgeving. Je hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden en een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Daarnaast heb je:
  • Ervaring met Java, SQL, Automatisch test scripting, System administratie (Unix/Linux); 3 tot 5 jaar ervaring in Java software development en met test ervaring.

Het is een pré als je ook ervaring hebt met: Java Web Services, Soap or Rest, Perl, Relational database (MySQL), JMeter, Atlassian Jira (voor Agile board) en Confluence (wiki), Jenkins and Docker (voor build en deployment automatisering).

Waar kom je terecht Als ervaren DevOps applicatie engineer kom jij te werken in het marktsegment Communications dat zich richt op alle grote telecom en mediabedrijven in Nederland. We leven in een wereld vol informatie waarin alles en iedereen is verbonden. Technologische vooruitgang en veranderend consumentengedrag hebben de bedrijfsomgeving voor de telecomindustrie veranderd. Het tempo waarin dit verandert ligt hoog. Het bieden van toegang tot communicatienetwerken is niet meer genoeg.

Binnen onze sector helpen we telecombedrijven in hun transformatie naar leveranciers van (digitale) belevingen. Al ruim 20 jaar zijn we actief in de (tele)communicatie industrie waarin we samen werken met toonaangevende bedrijven. Hierdoor kennen we de business én uitdagingen van telecom- en mediabedrijven en koppelen we dit aan onze IT-expertise. Samen met de andere professionals zet je in op service transities naar nieuwe diensten en werkwijzen (agile, lean), en netwerk transities (cloud based).

We willen het beste uit jou halen Wanneer je bij CGI gaat werken kom je terecht op een uitdagende werkvloer met professionele collega’s en ben je de bouwsteen binnen een hechte community. We stimuleren je in jouw ontwikkeling en bieden je hiervoor alle ruimte. Doorgroeien is vanzelfsprekend.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten: Bouw met ons aan je carrière Het is een bijzondere tijd binnen de wereld van IT, de digitale transformatie zit in een versnelling. CGI heeft een schat aan kennis en praktische ervaring op het gebied van digitale transformatie. Zo helpen wij onze klanten belangrijke stappen te zetten op de weg naar hun digitale transformatie en bieden we onze professionals uitdagende carrièremogelijkheden.

Ons succes is gebaseerd op het talent en de betrokkenheid van onze professionals. Samen, als één team, staan we voor de uitdagingen en delen we de beloningen die gepaard gaan met de groei van CGI. Dit versterkt het gevoel van eigenaarschap, want al onze professionals delen mee in de waarde die wij gezamenlijk creëren.

Kom werken bij CGI én bouw samen met ons aan een van de grootste, onafhankelijke, IT en zakelijke dienstverleners ter wereld.

Meer informatie Meer informatie over de inhoud van de vacature? Neem contact op met Frank Meijers (Director Consulting Delivery) via 06-139.88.801 of frank.meijers@cgi.com.

Vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem contact op met de afdeling Recruitment via (088) 564 00 00 of via recruitment.nl@cgi.com.

Meer informatie of vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure? Neem hiervoor contact op met de afdeling Recruitment via (088) 564 00 00.

Bezoek voor meer informatie over CGI: www.cginederland.nl.

Wij bieden onze professionals een gelijkwaardige behandeling en gelijke carrièrekansen.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld!

title: SOFTWARE ARCHITEKT (M/W/D) DAS & AUTOMATED DRIVING
description:
Standort Lippstadt, Deutschland

Pacesetting. Passionate. Together. Seit 1899 prägt HELLA als einer der Top-40-Automobilzulieferer weltweit die Branche mit innovativen Lichtsystemen und Fahrzeugelektronik. Daneben ist das Unternehmen einer der wichtigsten Partner des Ersatzteilehandels sowie der freien Werkstätten. Unser Antrieb: die Mobilität von Morgen zu gestalten und die zentralen Markttrends wie Autonomes Fahren, Effizienz und Elektrifizierung, Konnektivität und Digitalisierung sowie Individualisierung voranzutreiben. Dafür setzen sich täglich weltweit über 40.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter mit Leidenschaft, Know-how und Innovationskraft ein.

IHRE AUFGABEN

Als Software Architekt entwickeln Sie zukunftsorientierte Software-Architekturen im automobilen Umfeld der Fahrerassistenzsysteme (DAS) und für Komponenten des autonomen Fahrens.

  • In einem internationalen Team von SW Architekten und Entwicklern gestalten und verantworten Sie Teile der Softwarearchitektur innerhalb eines embedded MultiSensor- und MultiCore-Systems.
  • Sie analysieren, bewerten und stimmen die Anforderungen von Kunden und internen Stakeholdern ab und leiten daraus Anforderungen an die Software-Architektur ab.
  • In Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Experten berücksichtigen Sie dabei Anforderungen von Cyber Security und Funktionaler Sicherheit.

IHRE QUALIFIKATIONEN

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Fachrichtung Elektrotechnik oder Informatik
  • Erfahrung in der SW Architektur oder dem Embedded SW Engineering
  • Berufserfahrung oder Kenntnisse in Autosar wären wünschenswert und runden ihr Profil ab
  • Gute Kenntnisse in MS-Office
  • Teamfähigkeit, Durchsetzungsvermögen sowie analytische und kommunikative Kompetenz
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

UNSER ANGEBOT

  • Umfangreiche Karriere- und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten sowie flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle
  • HELLA in motion – umfassendes Sport- und Gesundheitsprogramm mit unternehmenseigenem Fitnesscenter
  • Unterstützung rund um das Thema Familie: Familienservice, zwei HELLA Kinderhäuser, KidsCamp in den Ferien sowie Beratung bei der Pflege Angehöriger
  • Betriebsrestaurants, Mitarbeitervergünstigungen und Wäscheservice
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit HELLA Zuschuss

#LI-GER

Nutzen Sie die Gelegenheit und entfalten Sie Ihr Potenzial in einem weltweit agierenden Familienunternehmen, das Ihnen beste Voraussetzungen für Ihren persönlichen Karriereweg bietet.

Bitte senden Sie uns Ihre Bewerbung über den bewerbungsformular oder unser Karriereportal unter Angabe der Kennziffer 20190319.

title: Full Stack Web Developer
description:
We are a digital product design and software development company located in the heart of downtown Detroit. We partner with organizations to create custom software solutions, web & mobile applications, and delightful customer experiences. Some of the companies we’ve partnered with include StockX, Emagine Entertainment, University of Michigan, Rock Ventures, Rocket Fiber, and the Detroit Regional Chamber, just to name a few.

We’re looking for an experienced software developer to join our team. This is a full-time, on-site position, with the flexibility to work from home or anywhere as long as you can join us in the office a few days a week.

Is this you?

  • Can you architect object-oriented software solutions?
  • Do you have a strong understanding of how a browser renders a website?
  • Are you confident in your software solutions?

What we're looking for:

  • Minimum of 5 years of software development experience.
  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent.
  • The use of version control is pinnacle in your workflow.
  • Comfortable architecting stable and flexible software solutions.
  • Experience with PHP, Node.js, Javascript, HTML and CSS.
  • Understand how RESTful APIs work and how to architect them.
  • Experience with custom WordPress development (plugins, themes, integrations).
  • Comfortable integrating third-party platforms using APIs and SDKs.
  • Experience with cross-browser and cross-platform website testing.
  • Understand the value of good documentation.
  • Comfortable developing projects with other developers.
  • Interested in continual learning and sharing knowledge with others.
  • Effective communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders.

Bonus Skills

  • Experience working with Parse Platform.
  • Experience with tools such as Composer and Webpack.
  • Experience working with AWS
  • Experience building mobile applications.
  • Cognizant of the security of data flow from browser to database.

Job Perks

  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Flexible schedule, including work from home, or from anywhere days
  • Performance based quarterly bonuses
  • 401K Retirement plan with employer contribution
  • Health and education allowance
  • Free parking
  • Team activities
  • MoGo annual bike pass
  • Fresh Chazzano's coffee & snacks
  • Work in a cool office space in downtown Detroit, with Herman Miller chairs and stand up desks

title: Senior / Senior Staff Android Engineer
description:
Matterport is a 3D immersive media SaaS company that makes it easy for anyone to quickly and inexpensively create a digital 3D model of any physical space. Our 3D immersive media platform is used across many industries to improve how people make decisions about properties. We are the world leader in the category we invented, having built digital models of over 1.5 million properties so far!

Starting with residential real estate, where 8% of all homes sold in the US last year had a Matterport 3D tour, the company has changed how people experience physical spaces. Our product offering is selling exponentially in new markets like apartments, vacation rentals, hotels, event venues, insurance, retail environments, as well as in architecture, engineering, and construction.

We have an end-to-end system for crafting, experiencing, and changing cloud-based immersive 3D models of real spaces. Our system improves the way people experience and visualize physical spaces making it incredibly fun and practical for users to move through real world spaces as if they were there.

We just closed $48 M in Series D revenue last month and were selected as the one of the fastest growing Bay Area private companies based on our year-to-year revenue growth!

We are seeking a Senior Android Software Engineer to help lead development for our 3D technology. We are working with partners to deliver state of the art capture experiences on next generation mobile and camera devices. Are you passionate about building phenomenal mobile software and motivated to take the lead in the creation of mobile apps for capturing, editing, and viewing 3D spaces and objects? If yes, please reach out to us!

Responsibilities:

Collaborate closely with the engineering team and product marketing to define, design, develop, and deliver new exciting features on Matterport’s capture applications Continuously explore, evaluate, and incorporate new technology into our products and processes to improve development efficiency Deliver a quality software solution using the Agile mobile development cycle Analyze business requirements, provide development estimates, feedback and proper implementation Develop, maintain, support, monitor and optimize existing mobile applications Research and recommend new mobile tools and applications

Requirements:

6+ years experience in high performance software development 2+ experience in Android mobile development experience with deep technical knowledge of mobile frameworks and how to build great reactive UI design You have a solid grasp of core software concepts, including networking, storage/file system, security, memory management, multi-threading, and application lifecycle management You are a thoughtful co-worker, enjoyable to work with, yet able to work independently with minimal supervision in a collaborative work environment.

Desired Skills:

3D graphics, odometry, photogrammetry knowledge Optimizing for performance on mobile (CPU/GPU/memory/latency) Experience working with embedded Android Experience working with RESTful web APIs BS or MS in Computer Science or similar field

title: Web Developer
description:

This role will support the maintenance of several websites hosting editorially independent online publications covering research in autism, data and life sciences, mathematics and physics, as well as sites providing information about the foundation's support of basic and applied research.

title: Senior Front End Developer
description:
Who We Are

Outly

At Outside Analytics we are passionate about the outdoors and building software that increases outdoor accessibility, usage, and understanding. We are building a data analytics and geospatial processing platform with an innovative web and mobile interface to empower people's outdoor experiences. We believe that the right technology can create stronger connections between people and nature, improve health and wellness, increase environmental empathy, and drive support for public land conservation.

Position Responsibilities

Development, test and deployment of complex and highly performant web applications. Assist in the development of strategic and technology roadmaps, and support the development of mobile applications.

Required Qualifications and Skills

  • Passionate about the outdoors and outdoor recreation
  • Expertise in React, Node, JavaScript, HTML, CSS
  • Proficiency working with mapping libraries and APIs such as Mapbox or Google Maps
  • API development and data driven RESTful web services
  • Performant querying of backend data stores such as SQL databases and Elasticsearch
  • Experience developing and deploying in Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • DevOps practices and development tool chains (Github, Jenkins, Chef, etc)
  • Interpersonal skills, taking accountability for objectives, working with minimal oversight

Additional Qualifications and Skills

  • Mobile development (iOS, Android, React Native)
  • Experience with 3D mapping technology (Cesium, Google Earth, etc.)
  • Familiarity with data science
  • UI/UX, graphic design

Education and Training Required

4 year college (Bachelor’s Degree) or higher. Computer Science degree preferred.

Minimum Years of Experience

4+ years of real world experience developing proven applications and systems.

Location

Boulder, Colorado

Other

Must be US Citizen
